skill.name: xlsx
skill.description: Comprehensive spreadsheet creation, editing, and analysis with support for formulas, formatting, data analysis, and visualization. When Claude needs to work with spreadsheets (.xlsx, .xlsm, .csv, .tsv, etc) for: (1) Creating new spreadsheets with formulas and formatting, (2) Reading or analyzing data, (3) Modify existing spreadsheets while preserving formulas, (4) Data analysis and visualization in spreadsheets, or (5) Recalculating formulas

security_audit.summary: This is an official skill from Anthropic and is pre-reviewed. A minimal audit was performed. No security issues were identified in the scanned files.

content.value_statement: Spreadsheet work is slow when formulas, formatting, and analysis require multiple tools. This skill creates, edits, analyzes, and recalculates files in one workflow.
actual_capabilities: Create new Excel workbooks with formulas and formatting using openpyxl
Edit existing spreadsheets while preserving formulas and styles
Read and analyze spreadsheet data with pandas
Recalculate formulas through a LibreOffice macro workflow
Scan all cells for Excel error values and report locations
limitations: Formulas are not evaluated by openpyxl without running recalc.py
Depends on local file access to read and write spreadsheets
Error reporting is limited to detected Excel error strings

use_cases.title: Update forecast model
use_cases.description: Refresh a multi-sheet model with new inputs while keeping formulas and audit trails.

use_cases.title: Clean monthly data
use_cases.description: Aggregate CSV exports into a formatted Excel report with summaries.

use_cases.title: Validate formula health
use_cases.description: Recalculate and check error cells across large workbooks.

prompt_templates.title: Create a new workbook
prompt_templates.scenario: Build a simple report with formulas
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an Excel file with a sales table, a total row using SUM, and bold headers. Save as sales_report.xlsx.

prompt_templates.title: Edit an existing file
prompt_templates.scenario: Update a template without breaking formulas
prompt_templates.prompt: Open budget.xlsx, insert a new row for Marketing, and add a formula in the Total column. Preserve formatting.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze with pandas
prompt_templates.prompt: Read metrics.xlsx and summarize averages by department. Write results to summary.xlsx with headers.

prompt_templates.title: Recalculate and validate
prompt_templates.prompt: Run recalc on model.xlsx and report any error cells. If errors exist, list the sheet and cell locations.

output_examples.input: Recalculate model.xlsx and summarize any errors found.

best_practices: Use formulas in Excel cells instead of hardcoded computed values
Recalculate with recalc.py after formula changes
Document sources for hardcoded assumptions in the sheet
anti_patterns: Overwrite formulas by saving with data_only enabled
Compute totals in Python and paste static values

faq.question: Which file formats are supported?
faq.answer: XLSX, XLSM, CSV, and TSV are supported for reading and writing workflows.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Formulas are not evaluated without recalc.py and LibreOffice installed.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing templates?
faq.answer: Yes, it uses openpyxl to preserve formulas and formatting during edits.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Files are processed locally and no network access is required for core tasks.

faq.question: How do I fix formula errors?
faq.answer: Run recalc.py, read the error locations, then correct the referenced cells.

faq.question: How does it compare to pandas only?
faq.answer: pandas is great for data, but openpyxl keeps Excel formulas and styles intact.
